definitions.definition: A reflection after an act; a later or subsequent thought, action, or expedient.
definitions.example: She packed her sandals only as an afterthought, but she was glad she did.

definitions.definition: Something additional to the original plan or concept.
definitions.example: This whole remodeling was an afterthought; we were only going to paint and call it good.

definitions.definition: (very rare except in the past tense, possibly nonstandard) To expound as an afterthought.
To think about after the fact, reflect on.
To repent, or feel remorse for; to regret.
